Program constructor. Create gl program and shaders. You can pass optional shader code to immediatly compile shaders

content.text: webgl context this program belongs to
an optional vertex shader code. See
compile
an optional fragment shader code See
compile
an optional string prepend to both fragment and vertex shader code. See
compile
compile
For the given vertex shader

Program class provide shader compilation and linking functionality.
             It also give you convenient access to active uniforms and attributes.
             Once compiled, the Program object list all used uniforms/attributes and provide getter/setter function for each one. See
Program
constructor.

summary.text:
Program.debug
  can be set to true to check and log compilation and linking errors (default to false)

Compile vertex and fragment shader then link gl program
This method can be safely called several times.
vertex shader code
fragment shader code
an optional string append to both fragment and vertex code
Delete program and shaders

alias program.bind()

content.text: Texture class manage TEXTURE_2D types textures
webgl context the texture belongs to
=GL_RGB] the pixel format, default to gl.RGB (can be gl.RGB, gl.RGBA, gl.LUMINANCE...)
=GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE] the pixel data type, default to gl.UNSIGNED_BYTE
the pixel internal format, default to the same value than 'format' parameter (which must be in webgl 1)
